department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Acquisition and delivery of personal protective equipment against fuels and flammable products for DND Bagotville
description: AMENDMENT TO CLOSING TIME: Please disregard the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline closing time and Buyandsell posting closing time. All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted at the latest by 2 PM EST on January 31, 2023. All bids submitted after 2 PM EST will result in the bid being declared non-responsive. Department of National Defense is issuing this Request for Proposals (RFP) for the purchase of Personal Protective Equipment against fuels and other flammable liquids for the entire supply section of the 3rd Mission Support Squadron (3 ESM). Full details of the requirement can be found in the solicitation, as detailed in Section 7.
full_summary:
### Tender Announcement
#### Contract Title
Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) against fuels and flammable products for the 3rd Mission Support Squadron (3 ESM) 

#### Contract Number
W0138-22A030

#### Solicitation Number
WS3664658508-Doc3664671513

#### Publication Date
November 15, 2022

#### Tender Closing Date and Time
January 31, 2023, 14:00 EST

#### Tender Description
The Department of National Defence is seeking a contractor to provide Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) against fuels and flammable products for the entire supply section of the 3rd Mission Support Squadron (3 ESM) in Bagotville,Québec.

#### Key Contract Details

* **Contract Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
* **Contract Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Delivery:** Quebec (excluding the National Capital Region)
* **End-User Entity:** Department of National Defence (DND)

#### Contact Information

Julien, Lisa-Marie (SPAC/PSPC)
lisa-marie.julien@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

The original text related to amendment and the original purchasing close deadline was missed while reading out all the information. However, the rephrased version gives a comprehensive view of the bidding process with following modifications already unaffected as mentioned earlier in previous point.
